body_html:
@zyavrik It looks like avx512 was introduced in gcc 4.9 so 4.8 works (as it does not have avx 512)
https://gcc.gnu.org/gcc-4.9/changes.html

I probably could take a look at it though I don't have access to Skylake so it will be hard to debug. Will play with gcc to see if I could reproduce the issue you encounter by feeding -m flags.

In the mean time, is your linux Ubuntu 16.04 or 14.04?

body:
@zyavrik It looks like avx512 was introduced in gcc 4.9 so 4.8 works (as it does not have avx 512)
https://gcc.gnu.org/gcc-4.9/changes.html

I probably could take a look at it though I don't have access to Skylake so it will be hard to debug. Will play with gcc to see if I could reproduce the issue you encounter by feeding `-m` flags.

In the mean time, is your linux Ubuntu 16.04 or 14.04?
